intro: Pinochia corymbosa subsp. portoricensis, commonly known as the Puerto Rican pinochia, is a shrub native to the Caribbean island of Puerto Rico. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are usually covered in a fine layer of hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal forests and rocky areas. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
